attributes.action: Have a referendum on London & Thames Valley independence
attributes.background: After the EU referendum, the UK voted to leave the EU, a decision which was not shown support by Scotland, Northern Ireland and the Thames Valley.The country has chosen to go in a direction of independence, whilst we have chosen unity.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of the young population wanted to remain and now have to live with the consequences and an uncertain future.

We have £478 billion, enough to be the 26th richest country.

attributes.action: We call for the dualling of A120 between Marks Tey  and Braintree
attributes.background: This road is becoming more and more dangerous as the road was not designed to take heavy traffic, and there are so many accidents on this stretch of road that local roads become impassable.
attributes.additional_details: every couple of months there is a serious accident so much so that the queue can stretch right back to the Roundabout linking to the dualled section of the A120. This causes chaos and it can become blocked from Coggeshall as well towards Colchester. This really is not good enough the government is messing us around, something needs doing now!

attributes.background: It's so important to help with the refugee crisis that I decided to help, I want to help turn an old field or old building into a nice beautiful hotel for refugees coming from poor war torn countries.

attributes.action: Allow smoke bombs/pyrotechnics at football matches.
attributes.background: It will improve the atmosphere at the games.

attributes.action: British Overseas Territories must be allowed to negotiate with the EU directly
attributes.background: British Overseas Territories benefit from a special relationship with the European Union allowing freedom of movement, international investment and direct EU financial input. There was no opportunity for Territories to vote in the referendum and the decision by the UK will impact them.
attributes.additional_details: British Overseas Territories benefit from a special relationship with the European Union allowing freedom of movement, international investment and direct EU financial input. Following the UK vote to leave the EU, all Overseas Territories, who had no opportunity to vote, require the ability to negotiate with the EU without restriction from the UK.

attributes.action: Trigger Article 50 and then immediately hold a general Election
attributes.background: Votes have been cast, now we demand the government deliver change. No politicians have a mandate to take this forward.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell cot bumper which can cause suffocation to babies.
attributes.background: The safety of cot bumpers is questionable because of the risk of suffocation and/or strangulation. They can also be used to climb on when your baby becomes more mobile so they're not recommended yet they still sold in stores to unaware parents.

attributes.action: Rename the 'House of Lords' to give it a gender neutral title.
attributes.background: The House of Lords immortalises the idea that it is men who rule the country. In order to take a significant step towards an otherwise overlooked deficiency in political equality, we should retitle the House of Lords so as to retain gender neutrality - for instance, to the House of Peers.
We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule that if the remain or leave vote is more than 50.1% based and a turnout of more than  55% there should not be another referendum.

attributes.action: Hold an early General Election when Brexit terms have been agreed.
attributes.background: Now that Britain has decided to leave, but on terms not yet agreed, it is only right that whatever the terms end up being that they are put to the people at a General Election to get a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Review of UK voting age - Vote at 16 not at 75
attributes.background:
Change law to allow 16 & 17 year olds a right to vote in the UK and debate a maximum voting age. The referendum highlighted the reality of these issues.

People that will be affected by an election or referendum must be allowed a vote and have a voice, those that will not be affected should not.
attributes.additional_details:
Life expectancy rates are 80 years old, so people aged 75 voted for something that statistically they will only be affected by for a few years, whereas, 16 and 17 year olds, who will be affected for the rest of their lives, were not allowed to vote, this is not right.

We should also debate a maximum voting age for special referendums only, not for general elections which occur every few years where everyone over 15 should be allowed to vote.

This needs to be done, the time is now, do it.

attributes.action: Allow EEA citizens that are living in the UK to vote in the 2nd EU referendum.
attributes.background: EEA citizens that have been living and working in the UK for at least 5 years should get the rights to vote in the 2nd EU referendum.

attributes.action: Allow 14-17 year olds to have their votes on the EU added to the  voting total
attributes.background:
The EU referendum is a vote for over 18 year olds to decide whether to stay or leave

This vote affects the futures of young people, and not the elderly, who are responsible for 60% of leave votes in the 65+ category. This raises the question of: Why shouldn't youths get to decide on their future?
attributes.additional_details:
-73% of 18-24 year olds voted to remain in the EU
-62% of 25-34 year olds voted to remain in the EU
-52% of 35-44 year olds voted to remain in the EU

These facts illustrate what the people who are affected most by the vote wanted. Sadly, they are having their futures decided by the older generations, to whom the vote will not affect.

By signing this petition, you are allowing the younger generation to decide on their own future.

Source: 'BBC News: EU referendum: The result in maps and charts'

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens on the UK electoral register for 5 years a vote in referendum.
attributes.background: With the cost of UK naturalisation for EU citizens being circa £2000 and requiring 3-5 years prior residence, the cost for EU citizens to gain full UK voting rights through full citizenship is extremely prohibitive. These individuals contribute immensely to the UK and yet are prevented from voting
attributes.additional_details:
It makes no sense that a UK citizen resident abroad, who hasn't been on the electoral register for up to 15 years can vote, whilst EU citizens contributing to our society and on the UK electoral register cannot.

This is further undermined by the fact that Gibraltarians, who are only in the EU by the skin of the UK's teeth, can vote in the referendum whilst citizens of fully committed EU states resident in the UK cannot!
